channel.title: Fight Tips
channel.description: Yesterday I was robbed fifty dollars during a Basketball game. A kid who i rarely associate with grabbed the money from my wallet which was sitting on the table next to everyone else's and tore off into the woods. I chased him 4 blocks to his house where he locked himself inside. He's refused to meet outside of school but continues to talk shit over twitter. So when I see him in school on Monday i'm working his ass. I've been in two fights before, won one and lost one. Any actually helpful tips?

item.title: Fight Tips
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

A well placed hit or as you call it, critical, is always going to be landed. That’s exactly what I said, but you said you don’t need to have power, you only need agility and speed. It has nothing to do with that, if you have power but no speed or agility then you will still eventually land a hit, and that’s going to hurt the opponent. If you have little power and speed or agility then you can’t do damage to your opponent as easily, you can only dodge, but as I said; you can only dodge for so long. To land an elbow blow you need to be close to your opponent, which isn’t somewhere you want to be for very long, especially in a street fight. I’m pretty strong, a lot stronger than the lead trainer of the gym I train with and he’s very well trained but when we spar I usually come up trumps because he’s between super bantamweight and lightweight and I’m heavyweight. Just because he’s not got as much power behind hits as I have, he’s got an easy ten years of training over me and I still win just because of my size. I’d take power over agility in an offensive sport anyday.

Read full topic

item.title: Fight Tips
item.dc:creator: @Ambokile Ambokile
item.description:
@Ambokile wrote:

A strong skilled fighter will beat a weak skilled fighter, a strong unskilled fighter will beat a weak unskilled fighter.

Read full topic

item.title: Fight Tips
item.dc:creator: @strucker Strucker
item.description:
@strucker wrote:

You dont have to be really strong, because there are “Critical hits” if we could call them like that, you dont have to be really strong to dodge and counter attack with your elbow, that really hurts, and you dont have to be any strong, obvisouly if you’re stronger that’d be cool, but not too strong because the attack would take longer to executee

Read full topic

item.title: Fight Tips
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

[quote=“Strucker, post:82, topic:518569”]Actually i do karate and you dont have to be any strong, its about hitting faster.
obviously if he is stronger and he gets to punch you you’re done, but as long as you are fast enough, you could just crouch and then hit him in the tummy with your knee, idk lol[/quote]
That’s completely inaccurate. Speed and agility are good but I can guarantee if you have little power behind your shots you won’t have any kind of significant impact, you can only dodge for so long before you’re on the wrong side of a hayemaker. Regardless of any of that, you should know that karate is a defensive martial art and that avoiding hits only lasts for so long.

Read full topic

obviously if he is stronger and he gets to punch you you’re done, but as long as you are fast enough, you could just crouch and then hit him in the tummy with your knee, idk lol

item.title: Fight Tips
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

Ambokile:

I punched a guy in the temple and it knocked him out and caused him to have a seizure, very scary knowing the potential damage

Exactly this, the temple is a very dangerous place to hit in an unmonitored and uncontrolled environment. It’s all fair and well hitting someone but you have to be respectable when you fight, if not then you’re no better than they are. Do damage, but nothing too severe. If you can stick to body shots, stick to body shots.

Read full topic

item.title: Fight Tips
item.dc:creator: @Ambokile Ambokile
item.description:

I punched a guy in the temple and it knocked him out and caused him to have a seizure, very scary knowing the potential damage

Read full topic

item.title: Fight Tips
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

Be very careful of temple punches because they can quite easily escalate. The best spot you can hope to take first in a punch for a lot of pain and a quick takedown is between where the jaw and cheekbone meet and the side of their nose. If you’ve recently ducked one of their swings, be sure that on your way up to drive one right on their chin and swing in with a kick to either the side of the knee or just below the ribs. You’re pretty much guaranteed to win if any of those combinations are used against an untrained fighter.

Read full topic

item.title: Fight Tips

item.title: Fight Tips
item.dc:creator: @Ambokile Ambokile
item.description:
@Ambokile wrote:

Surprise him.

Keep your arms by your side but establish a good swinging position, as soon as there’s a smart comment launch a punch at his face (preferably jaw) and then continue.

Read full topic
